sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"文化，文明"之意。
means: civilization ： 指广义的文化，标志人类发展开化的进程。强调物质方面的文明。
culture ： 侧重指精神方面，即多由科技、文化等所体现的人类智力开发的程度。

aqui水+culture[n.文化,文明;修养;耕种;栽培,培育]→n.[生物]水产养殖
arbori=arbor+culture[n.文化,文明;修养;耕种;栽培,培育]→n.树木的培植
cult耕种,培养→培养[感情]→崇拜,引申为教派
cultivate[v.耕作,栽培,养殖;培养,教养,磨炼]+ion动作或状态→n.耕作,培养

stems_affixes.value_cn: 文化,文明;修养;耕种;栽培,培育

flori=flor花+culture[n.文化,文明;修养;耕种;栽培,培育]→n.花艺, 栽培花卉
pisci鱼+culture[n.文化,文明;修养;耕种;栽培,培育]→n.养鱼学, 养鱼业

entry.def: Culture consists of activities such as the arts and philosophy, which are considered to be important for the development of civilization and of people's minds.

example.ex: There is just not enough fun and frivolity in culture today.
example.tran: 当今的文化恰恰是不够轻松有趣。

entry.def: A culture is a particular society or civilization, especially considered in relation to its beliefs, way of life, or art.
entry.tran: 文化(尤指拥有特定信仰、生活方式或艺术形式的社会或文明）

example.tran: 来自不同文化背景的人们

example.ex: I was brought up in a culture that said you must put back into the society what you have taken out.
example.tran: 我成长于其中的那个社会文化认为，取之社会必须回报社会。

entry.def: The culture of a particular organization or group consists of the habits of the people in it and the way they generally behave.
entry.tran: 文化(某组织或群体的一致习惯和行为方式)

example.ex: But social workers say that this has created a culture of dependency, particularly in urban areas...
example.tran: 然而社会工作者认为这使得人们普遍产生了依赖，尤其是在城市地区。

example.ex: The institutions have realised they need to change their culture to improve efficiency and service.
example.tran: 这些机构已经意识到需要改变他们的内部文化以提高效率、改进服务。

entry.def: In science, a culture is a group of bacteria or cells which are grown, usually in a laboratory as part of an experiment.
entry.tran: 培养物;培养菌;培养细胞

example.tran: 多次组织细胞培养实验

entry.def: In science, to culture a group of bacteria or cells means to grow them, usually in a laboratory as part of an experiment.

example.ex: To confirm the diagnosis, the hospital laboratory must culture a colony of bacteria.
example.tran: 为进一步确诊，医院实验室必须培养一个细菌菌落。

means.word_mean: 1. a particular society at a particular time and place;
2. the tastes in art and manners that are favored by a social group
3. all the knowledge and values shared by a society
4. (biology) the growing of microorganisms in a nutrient medium (such as gelatin or agar);

sentences.sentence: "the culture of cells in a Petri dish"

means.word_mean: 5. (bacteriology) the product of cultivating micro-organisms in a nutrient medium
6. a highly developed state of perfection; having a flawless or impeccable quality;

sentences.sentence: "I admired the exquisite refinement of his prose"
"almost an inspiration which gives to all work that finish which is almost art"--Joseph Conrad

means.word_mean: 7. the attitudes and behavior that are characteristic of a particular social group or organization;

sentences.sentence: "the reason that the agency is doomed to inaction has something to do with the FBI culture"

means.word_mean: 8. the raising of plants or animals;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a cultivated piece of land): the noun from French culture or directly from Latin cultura 'growing, cultivation'; the verb from obsolete French culturer or medieval Latin culturare, both based on Latin colere 'tend, cultivate' (see cultivate). In late Middle English the sense was 'cultivation of the soil' and from this (early 16th cent.), arose 'cultivation (of the mind, faculties, or manners'); sense 1 dates from the early 19th cent

sentences.cn: 因此，在他看来，文化的各个方面，比如家庭结构、婚姻形式、亲属关系、财产归属、政府形式、科技以及食物生产体系，都会随着社会的进化而改变。
sentences.en: Thus, in his view, diverse aspects of culture, such as the structure of families, forms of marriage, categories of kinship, ownership of property, forms of government, technology, and systems of food production, all changed as societies evolved.

sentences.cn: 历史特殊论强调各种文化的独特性，为人类学研究指明了新方向。
sentences.en: Historical particularism, which emphasized the uniqueness of all cultures, gave new direction to anthropology.

sentences.cn: 博厄斯认为任何社会的文化都必须被理解为某一独特历史时期的产物，而非属于某一更加广义的进化阶段或文化类型的许多文化之一。
sentences.en: Boas felt that the culture of any society must be understood as the result of a unique history and not as one of many cultures belonging to a broader evolutionary stage or type of culture.

sentences.cn: 由于博厄斯的许多学生的影响，令历史特殊论在美国人类学的文化研究中占据主导地位。
sentences.en: Historical particularism became a dominant approach to the study of culture in American anthropology, largely through the influence of many students of Boas.

sentences.cn: 有些人类学家认为，几乎所有重要的文化成果都来自少数的民族的发明，尤其是具备天赋的民族。根据文化传播论者的看法，这些成果后来又传播到了其他文化当中。
sentences.en: Some attributed virtually every important cultural achievement to the inventions of a few, especially gifted peoples that, according to diffusionists, then spread to other cultures.

sentences.cn: 对社会功能和文化关系的研究成为欧洲人类学尤其是英国人类学的一个重要主题。
sentences.en: An interest in the relationship between the function of society and culture became a major theme in European, and especially British, anthropology.

sentences.cn: 哈佛大学肯尼迪学院的约翰·多纳休指出，西方公务员制度的文化规范适合那些寻求安稳的人，而不适合追求事业大获成功的人。
sentences.en: John Donahue at Harvard’s Kennedy School points out that the norms of culture in Western civil services suit those who want to stay put but is bad for high achievers.

sentences.cn: 计算机就是21世纪的文化机器。
sentences.en: The computer is the 21st century’s culture machine.

sentences.en: Similar results in anthocyanin accumulation were obtained when inflorescences and rfs were cultured in vitro.

sentences.cn: 广播3台在培养全国的音乐修养.
sentences.en: Radio 3 is here to develop the musical culture of the country.

sentences.cn: 我有一个朋友,是一位有修养的绅士.
sentences.en: A friend of mine is a cultured gentleman.

sentences.cn: 他是一个有修养的人.
sentences.en: He is a man of culture.

sentences.cn: 体育教师的素质修养,是搞好学校体育教育的基础和关键.
sentences.en: The quality culture of sports teacher is the basis and key point of physical education.

sentences.cn: 我们还要付出许多努力,才能加入具有文化修养国家的行列.
sentences.en: Much still needs to be done before it can join the ranks of cultured nations.

sentences.cn: 她是一个有修养、有风度的女人.
sentences.en: She is a woman of culture and taste.

sentences.cn: 他没多少文化修养.
sentences.en: He is a man of little culture.

sentences.cn: 凭你的修养态度,你能记住所有遇到的人.
sentences.en: You can mesmerize anyone you meet with your cultured attitude and outlook.

sentences.cn: 不过,拍出它们的人,却显然是一个以有修养的活力,唤起人们同情心的人.
sentences.en: Yet they are made by a person who obviously cultivated compassion with cultured energy.

sentences.cn: 你用有修养的面具演示太久了,以至于人们都忘了你是个罪犯.
sentences.en: You push the cultured facade long enough, people forget you are a criminal.

sentences.cn: 他的信没有显示出很高的修养.
sentences.en: His letters do not show proof of great culture.

sentences.cn: 人应有足够的文化修养,以便能以怀疑的眼光看待文化.
sentences.en: A man should be just cultured enough to be able to look with suspicion upon culture.

sentences.cn: 善于感恩是大学生必备的道德修养.
sentences.en: Being adroit at indebted action is a moral culture that every student can do.

sentences.cn: 版式设计是现代设计师必须具有的艺术修养与技术知识.
sentences.en: Layout design is a modern designer must have the artistic culture and technical knowledge.

sentences.cn: 修养意指努力于自己和自己的心灵趋于完善.
sentences.en: Culture means trying to perfect oneself and one's own mind.

sentences.cn: 科学素养是建立在人的素质和科学素质的基础上的一种高层次的修养.
sentences.en: Science literacy is high culture based on the human and science diathesis.

sentences.cn: 它的创作既有其理论基础,也与建筑师的艺术修养有关.
sentences.en: It's based on some academic foundation but also relates with the architect's artistic culture.

sentences.cn: 有的是巨大的力量,会像修养到家的人那样用激情来骗人上当.
sentences.en: There are large forces which allure with all the soulfulness of expressionthe most cultured human.

sentences.cn: 高校校园文化对于大学生的成长、成熟起着引导方向 、 提升修养 、 学习规范、指导社会化等多种作用.
sentences.en: Campus culture influences the growth and maturity of college students of guiding, improving, regulating and directing.

sentences.cn: 视听文化时代, 把音乐元素引进《思想道德修养》课堂是一种行之有效的方法.
sentences.en: In audiovisual culture era, to introduce music elements into moral education class is an effective way.

sentences.cn: 教师良好的礼仪修养具有重要的教育价值.
sentences.en: Teachers'good amenity and culture have important educational value.

sentences.cn: 对于修养心性有兴趣的人来说,巴黎是个好城市.
sentences.en: Paris is a good city for people who are interested in culture.

sentences.cn: 但是,这恰恰将语文的修养过程本末倒置.
sentences.en: But this is to begin literary culture at the wrong end.

sentences.cn: 促进家长及学校间的伙伴关系,培育有修养 、 创意及自信的学生.
sentences.en: Advancing effective partnership between parents and school in nurturing cultured, creative and confident pupils.

sentences.cn: 他们没修养，很乏味，是一群无聊古板的老家伙。
sentences.en: They're not cultured or interesting, they are boring stodgy old things.

sentences.cn: 桑蚕养殖
